definition: to take by the arm and assist/to mix/to blend/to dilute/to adulterate

sentences.english: Don't mix up the two kinds of vegetable seeds.
sentences.chinese: 別把這兩種菜籽攙雜在一起。

sentences.english: Learn at school in the crowd JiangYongQuan mixed gaze, his eyes full of respect.
sentences.chinese: 娟子攙雜在人羣中凝視姜永泉，目光中充溢敬重。

sentences.english: Up to date, the doped lithium niobate crystal is the most ideal three dimensional storage materi…
sentences.chinese: 攙雜鈮酸鋰晶體是目前最理想的三維光折變存儲材料。

sentences.english: Should he place his catastrophe as a third associate in their felicity ?
sentences.chinese: 他要把他的災禍攙雜在他們兩人的幸福裏嗎？

sentences.english: But your reason always is adulterating the rumour.
sentences.chinese: 但是你的理由總是攙雜着謊言。

sentences.english: After I want you, is not mixed with other emotional thinking, clear thinking.
sentences.chinese: 大一會想你，不攙雜其它感情的想，特乾淨的想。

sentences.english: Do not wear clothes of wool and linen woven together.
sentences.chinese: 不可穿羊毛，細麻兩樣攙雜料作的衣服。

definition: legendary magic potion of immortals/panacea/fig. wonder solution to a problem
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
to store/to have sth in storage
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
hard to distinguish real from imitation
